decks.notes: The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain control of the board with aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan through countermagic and removal spells. By combining efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer with disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to apply pressure quickly and efficiently, all while disrupting the opponent's strategy and protecting its own threats. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells, with a focus on using powerful lands like Wasteland and dual lands.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, while utilizing creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Wirewood Symbiote to go off with powerful combo spells like Natural Order and Glimpse of Nature. The goal is to quickly flood the board with Elves and then either overwhelm the opponent with a Craterhoof Behemoth or tutor for key pieces with Green Sun's Zenith. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Deathrite Shaman and Reclamation Sage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a game-winning combo.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic and disruptive spells like Stifle, while also utilizing cards like Young Pyromancer to generate additional threats. The mana base is well-tuned to support the deck's aggressive playstyle, with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Predict, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. Key cards like Back to Basics and Terminus help to keep the opponent's threats in check, while cards like Snapcaster Mage and Force of Will provide flexibility and protection. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually grind out a win through card advantage and impactful spells.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively play Eldrazi creatures using ramp from lands like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer while also presenting large threats like Reality Smasher and Endbringer. With access to cards like Karakas and Mishra's Factory for additional utility, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately aiming to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this Grixis Aggro Legacy deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis while also employing disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also aims to generate additional value through Young Pyromancer and spell-slinging cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. This allows the deck to apply pressure early on and maintain tempo throughout the game, ultimately overwhelming the opponent and securing victory.

The focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats such as Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer while disrupting opponents with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt while utilizing the graveyard with Deathrite Shaman and Gurmag Angler. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells, with a focus on tempo and disruption to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using lands as a resource. By utilizing cards such as Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam, the player aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, while also setting up powerful land combos like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes tools for removal and card advantage, such as Punishing Fire and Gamble. Overall, the goal is to outvalue the opponent through careful manipulation of the board state and resource management.

The deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents with card advantage from cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes a strong equipment package with Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its creatures. Additionally, the deck utilizes mana denial with Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman to keep opponents off balance.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly with the aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck has strong card advantage and selection tools with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is optimized for consistent early game plays, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Deathrite Shaman to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes disruption spells like Abrupt Decay, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The addition of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional means of card advantage and removal. The deck aims to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategies to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the powerful combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 flying, indestructible Marit Lage token in just one turn. It uses cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Duress to search for and protect the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Pithing Needle. Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal provide fast mana acceleration, while Dark Confidant provides card advantage. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through its combo while controlling the game with its disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Heritage Druid, as well as lands like Gaea's Cradle. It then aims to quickly draw through the deck with Glimpse of Nature and set up combos with cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also utilizes Natural Order to quickly bring out powerful threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around using elves to generate mana, draw cards, and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to apply pressure on the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting their game plan with spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. The deck also aims to maintain a solid mana base with cards like Wasteland and fetch lands, allowing for consistent plays. Gitaxian Probe helps to gain information about the opponent's hand and make informed decisions. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around tempo, disruption, and efficient threats to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck is focused on generating a large amount of mana and casting a high number of spells in order to create a storm count, which is then used to generate a large number of copies of a specific spell, in this case, Empty the Warrens. The deck includes various cards for card selection and card advantage, such as Ponder, Gitaxian Probe, and Brainstorm, to help ensure the combo can be assembled quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's plans and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts, particularly Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek, to create a recurring source of flying creatures and gain life. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Ensnaring Bridge to control the board, while using planeswalkers like Tezzeret and Dack Fayden for card advantage and additional artifact synergy. With a mix of acceleration from Mox Diamond and powerful removal options like Toxic Deluge, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a combination of aggression and resource denial.
